Look for something working in one category and bring it to another.
==========
﻿Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 893-898 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 20. Mai 2024 09:58:43

Okay. Now we are going to use a Customer First Approach to explore our idea for a dog-walking app: 1. Call or text three people right now who have dogs and ask them to pay you to walk their dog. 2. Turns out none of these dog owners have problems walking their dog. You discover their real problem is finding dog sitters when they’re traveling. 3. Ask for their next travel dates and have them pay you a deposit. They pay: jackpot!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 1013-1017 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 08:24:36

It’s easier to sell to a large group of people who’ve already spent money on a product or service. Some ideas could be: 1. Customizing Nike shoes. 2. Video game tutorial for an Xbox game. 3. Teaching computer novices how to use a MacBook.

Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 1092-1095 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:24:11

You, dear reader, are a surfer. What you’re selling—the product or service—is your surfboard. The market is the wave, and the wave is what matters most. Even if you’re a great surfer with an amazing board, you will still fail if you don’t have a good wave to ride.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 1097-1100 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:47:22

Take New York City’s professional line sitter, Robert Samuel. After getting fired from his customer service job at AT& T, he noticed the frenzy created by every new iPhone release. So he put an ad on Craigslist in 2012 to validate whether anyone would pay for him to wait in line. When he was paid $325 for his first fifteen-hour stint, he knew he had a wave.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 69 | bei Position 1111-1113 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:49:13

What I’m saying here is that your job is not to create demand for something that seems exciting, it’s to find existing demand and satisfy it.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 1127-1128 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:53:00

In order to have a million-dollar business, you need a million-dollar opportunity.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 1132-1136 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:54:02

There are two key questions to answer to make sure it’s a million-dollar opportunity: 1. Is the overall market dying, flat, or growing? You want flat or ideally growing! 2. Is this a million-dollar opportunity? To figure that out, we have to know the number of potential customers and the price of your product.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 1138-1139 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:54:37

use Google Trends and Facebook Ads to answer those questions. They’re great tools that help me evaluate the size and growth potential of my target market.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 1140-1148 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 09:55:31

1. Is the market growing or dying? Search Google Trends for the terms “beard” and “beard grooming” and compare their search popularity to similar terms (for example, “haircuts,” “razors”) and how that’s changed over the last few months and years. With Google Trends you are just looking to see how the graphs are trending – ideally up and to the right. 2. How many potential customers are there? I’d highly recommend using Facebook Ads to research your market size. Facebook is pretty much the entire world, and what’s phenomenal is that they actually let you type in the keyword of whatever business category you’re thinking about and see the approximate audience size. You can also use the Facebook Ads Library to see every single active ad running on Facebook for your keyword and location, which is super helpful for uncovering competitors and getting ideas for your own marketing efforts.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 76 | bei Position 1180-1180 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 10:06:11

All you want is to know if the business idea is worth pursuing.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 80 | bei Position 1228-1230 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 10:28:59

PRO TIP: When you’re launching a business, always ask yourself: is this going to be a one-off purchase, something customers buy here and there when they want to consume it, or can you make it a monthly recurring sale?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 80 | bei Position 1240-1248 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 10:31:58

Here are the six Revenue Dials you can use: 1. Average order value: Increase the amount someone purchases. 2. Frequency: Increase how often someone will buy your service. 3. Price point: Increase or decrease your price point to affect total sales. 4. Customer type: Approach a more lucrative/wealthier customer segment. 5. Product line: Add additional products to make the business more attractive to start. 6. Add-on services: If you’re selling a product like cookies, can you offer a service like setting up birthday parties or cooking at the person’s home?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 82 | bei Position 1255-1256 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 28. Mai 2024 10:34:05

The hard part is not choosing which business idea. The hard part is getting customers. And that’s where you’ll focus first.

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 87 | bei Position 1305-1310 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 31. Mai 2024 08:51:21

The benefits of Validation are immediate and critical: 1. You don’t waste time. 2. You save money. 3. You find out if you can actually get customers for your idea. 4. You get money up front. 5. You light a fire under your butt to get moving.
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 88 | bei Position 1319-1321 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 31. Mai 2024 08:58:09

Your first customer is a friend, the second customer is someone in your family, but your third customer is HARD. You think this is easy? Then get three customers. Don’t worry about building a business, we are ONLY validating your idea. And if it’s this hard now, it’ll ONLY get harder.
==========

The promise of payment is not validation. That’s polite rejection. Getting customers to hand over their dollars makes it real. But you need to get real money, from
==========

Validation is a conversation. Not a sales pitch, but a chat to learn about the customer, see if you can help them and if they’ll actually pay you.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1382-1385 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 31. Mai 2024 09:18:46

The process to validate your solution with your Dream Ten can be broken down to a three-part framework: 1. Listen 2. Options 3. Transition
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1387-1389 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 31. Mai 2024 09:20:24

What’s the most frustrating thing about what’s currently going on? How would having X make your life better? What do you think that X should cost?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1393-1394 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 00:31:27

The bigger the pain, the bigger the opportunity!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1402-1403 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 11:23:49

Often you can distill your offer down to three parts: Price + Benefit + Time. Strung together, they form an offer sentence. Other examples:
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1406-1407 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 11:26:27

PRO TIP: Presenting your offer as a comparison can make it easier for your customer to understand. “We are like X but Y.”
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 1418-1420 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 11:29:03

PRO TIP: Always follow up by sending an email to your first customers asking for feedback. Feedback is a gift you can continually use to improve yourself and your business.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 1424-1425 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 11:30:31

When I get shot down while validating, I have a simple four-question script that flips the no into new knowledge, new ideas, and maybe even new customers.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1428-1436 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 11:32:00

“Why not?” It’s really easy to get scared from attacking this one head-on, because what happens if their criticism is right? But that’s exactly what you want to know! 2. “Who is one person you know who would really like this?” Always, always, always ask for a referral! Be specific about what kind of referral and use a number; this makes it highly effective. 3. “What would make this a no-brainer for you?” If they don’t want your product, maybe they’d want something related to it. If they don’t want to pay for your dog care app, what about dog walking? A dog hotel? Dog dating? 4. “What would you pay for that?” One of the hardest things in a startup is setting prices. Getting potential customers to say what they’d pay is pure gold!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 103 | bei Position 1495-1496 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 12:36:51

Then they run a bunch of ads to send people to the site and see if people actually will enter an email address to get on the mailing list, or even preorder the product.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 103 | bei Position 1498-1500 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 14:35:23

My recommendation for you is if you feel you have to do this, limit your work to forty-eight hours so you won’t spend a bunch of time fruitlessly playing with your ads and landing pages or wasting money.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1511-1512 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 14:39:30

If you go this route, don’t overthink the design, the name, the language, the ads, or any of that. Just focus on seeing if you can get people to buy your product!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1514-1514 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 14:39:42

Your challenge is to get at least three paying customers within forty-eight hours.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1526-1528 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 4. Juni 2024 14:42:29

After you’ve validated, if no one is buying, choose another idea and start over. Head back to chapter 3 and begin again! If you’ve validated your idea with at least three customers, that’s AMAZING! YOU DID IT, my friend! YOU HAVE A BUSINESS! Boom!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1583-1586 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 5. Juni 2024 15:20:34

A community who already knows you, who follows you, who is rooting for you is one of the most powerful forces in business, and it’s created through generosity. Adding value without expectation. Helping them with their journey without asking for an immediate return. Sometimes it’s help- ing them by boosting their self-esteem with a simple compliment.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1612-1613 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 14. Juni 2024 18:44:46

“What’s your unique angle in thirty seconds or less?” In other words, why would anyone care to read his newsletter?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1620-1624 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 14. Juni 2024 18:48:22

1. He defines who he is, 2. Why you should trust him, 3. What he is passionate about, and 4. What unique thing this prepares him to do for you.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 115 | bei Position 1627-1627 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 14. Juni 2024 18:50:39

Take a minute, and as Ben has done, write out a pitch in your journal describing your special sauce.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1616-1618 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 14. Juni 2024 18:51:51

“I’ve been a performance coach for the last fourteen years, working with the best athletes in the world. Helping people perform better is my groove. I want to help anybody who wants to have a great day and shift them into the mentality to dominate their life. I have information to share when it comes to dealing with the best.”
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1639-1644 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 14. Juni 2024 18:53:57

The platforms are going to change. But what won’t change is how you pick one. You need to know three things to choose: 1. Which site has the audience you want to connect with? 2. What medium do YOU enjoy creating content in? 3. What disproportionate results will you get compared to the work you put in?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1644-1645 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:22:15

let’s break down how I chose my platform. To start, I eliminated the ones that don’t work for me.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1668-1669 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:29:13

The MORE important part is to start with just one as an experiment. For me it was … YouTube!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1679-1680 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:33:24

The key principle is to start right now to build your audience and then move them to your email list (which we’ll cover in the next chapter).
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1685-1687 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:34:40

Choose your one platform, and using the unique angle pitch you wrote out before, clean up and rewrite your profile/bio on that platform to reflect who you are and how you help your ideal customer. Here’s my bio: Chief Sumo at @AppSumo. #30 at Facebook. Helping entrepreneurs at Okdork.com.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1699-1701 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:37:29

Ali uses what I call the Content Circle Framework. The basic idea is to start with specific topics for a tiny circle to build raving fans, then slowly expand your circle of content to influence larger groups of people.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1701-1709 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:38:10

Core Circle: Start with a very narrow audience. Ali started with the medical school exams for British people. Your niche within a niche can be the most obscure thing imaginable, as long as it makes you and your audience passionate. 2. Medium Circle: As you move bigger, your content should overlap somewhat with what concerns your Core Circle, but it should appeal to a broader audience. Ali started talking about studying and productivity in general, since that’s required for all students. 3. Large Circle: Here you go for the largest audience possible that’s still related. Some of Ali’s most watched videos are about his salary—made possible by his medical video fame—or the latest Apple product—which he uses to increase productivity. All the circles should still include your core audience but keep expanding your circle of influence.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1723-1724 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:41:37

But it all started with serving a niche within a niche—backyard farmers who wanted to raise chickens.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1725-1729 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:45:03

Here’s a formula you can use—outcome you’ll deliver + target market. Here’s an example of Content Circles for a housecleaning company: Core Circle: How to clean your evaporative cooler + in the Southwest USA. Medium Circle: How to choose laundry detergents + for new homeowners. Large Circle: The ten best vacuums + for a family.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 123 | bei Position 1730-1733 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:45:47

To come up with your unique viewpoint, ask yourself a few questions: What is something everyone thinks is true—but you think is wrong? What is something nobody in your target market is talking about—but should be? What are the biggest mistakes people in your market are making—but are totally blind to?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 123 | bei Position 1733-1734 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:46:13

Ultimately, your audience wants to learn something from you that’s relevant, useful, and surprising.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 123 | bei Position 1735-1739 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:46:52

Create your own Content Circle. Think back to your validation days: Who are the customers you want to appeal to and what’s the outcome you can create content for? What’s the unique point of view in your content they’d be excited to hear about? Formula = Outcome you’ll deliver + the target market Core Circle: Medium Circle: Large Circle:
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 1747-1748 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:49:08

Some of my most popular videos feature me failing, often. It’s fascinating that people want to see what’s really going on, not the highlight reel we think they want.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 125 | bei Position 1753-1755 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:51:00

The cool thing with becoming your audience’s guide is it makes them want to interact with you. That’s why I regularly co-create with my audience by doing the business equivalent of schoolyard dares. Like when I dared my Monthly1K class to supply me with a business idea to validate, which became Sumo Jerky.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 125 | bei Position 1761-1770 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:53:43

Post one piece of content. Now it’s time to post content publicly. Now, this piece of content can come in any format. You know I LOVE me some YouTube, but as you’ve seen, dif- ferent niches work on different platforms. The content you create can be a YouTube video, a Twitter thread, or a blog post. You’ve already taken the first steps in this chapter. 1. Your Unique Angle—the secret sauce nobody else has 2. The Platform you’re going to post on 3. Your Content Circle—the narrow audience who you’ll laser-target 4. Posting it TODAY This last step is obviously the hardest one. Don’t worry about scripts, camera equipment, or even if it gets any views. The important part is taking the first step at building your community.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 125 | bei Position 1760-1770 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 12:53:50

CHALLENGE Post one piece of content. Now it’s time to post content publicly. Now, this piece of content can come in any format. You know I LOVE me some YouTube, but as you’ve seen, dif- ferent niches work on different platforms. The content you create can be a YouTube video, a Twitter thread, or a blog post. You’ve already taken the first steps in this chapter. 1. Your Unique Angle—the secret sauce nobody else has 2. The Platform you’re going to post on 3. Your Content Circle—the narrow audience who you’ll laser-target 4. Posting it TODAY This last step is obviously the hardest one. Don’t worry about scripts, camera equipment, or even if it gets any views. The important part is taking the first step at building your community.
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1833-1834 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 13:13:11

More important, it opened my eyes to the singular power of email. I now could see how social media, telling stories, and email could create a really large business.

Email is the king and queen of communicating with customers.

Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 144 | bei Position 1973-1977 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:37:54

CHALLENGE Create a Lead Magnet. It’s time to create your first Lead Magnet using the process we’ve just outlined above. You can use your piece of content from the previous chapter as a base or start something new. Don’t spend more than two hours on the first iteration. If you want to turn it into a big thing later on, great. But start SMALL. Go to MillionDollarWeekend.com to get Lead Magnet templates! (See what I did there?)
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 145 | bei Position 1989-1990 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:40:39

Here’s the three-step progression of emails that I’ve found works best: 1. Welcome Email
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 146 | bei Position 1996-1996 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:41:06

2. Connection Email
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 146 | bei Position 1998-1999 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:41:25

3. Content Email
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 147 | bei Position 2010-2013 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:44:42

Second, with the Connection Email, you’re explicitly asking them to connect with you on social media, by following you on Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, and so on. Finally, the Content Email is where you give them a piece of great content—a blog post like Chris Von Wilpert’s, a video, or the invite to an event.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 146 | bei Position 2003-2004 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:45:25

First, the Welcome Email is just what it says it is: a big bear hug of a welcome telling your new subscriber how happy you are that they just joined your band of pirates and what sort of stuff they should expect from you.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 148 | bei Position 2018-2022 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:46:29

CHALLENGE Set up an autoresponder. I happen to think7 SendFox.com (I helped build it) is pretty darned good, but there are a bunch of others that I recommend, like ConvertKit.com and Mailchimp.com. Go to MillionDollarWeekend.com for a free tutorial and templates you can copy for yourself.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 149 | bei Position 2047-2049 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:49:35

Lean in and commit to 100 reps. (Think of this as doing reps and practicing as opposed to failing or succeeding.) This changes your mindset and makes it much easier to sustain forward motion when things get tough.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 150 | bei Position 2051-2053 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:50:51

If you want to start a YouTube channel, publish 100 videos. If you’re doing a newsletter, write 100 emails. If you’re starting a new hobby like chess or guitar, practice for 100 days. If you’re creating a business, directly pitch 100 customers.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 150 | bei Position 2058-2060 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:51:47

CHALLENGE The Law of 100. Commit to doing 100 emails, posts, or whatever action will move you closer to your goals. To live up to your commitment, use the Law of 100 Grid below to track your progress—and don’t break the chain!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 2062 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:51:57


==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2077-2078 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:55:55

Here are my five exact questions to create your own marketing plan
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2079-2084 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 16. Juni 2024 21:56:01

1. What is your one goal for this year? 2. Who exactly is your customer and where can you find them? 3. What is one marketing activity you can double down on? 4. How can you delight your first 100 customers? 5. If you HAD to double your business with no money in thirty days, what would you do?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2101-2104 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 18:55:39

Your goal is the one number that matters most. Starting with the destination makes planning the route much easier. PRO TIP: Be specific. One of the most common mistakes I see from entrepreneurs when they set goals is they say they want “more.” More revenue, more traffic, more downloads. But how much and by when?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2107-2109 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 18:57:41

Once you have a goal and a time frame, you can break down your goal into a timeline of smaller targets. Besides making your goals feel more achievable, having a timeline is crazy motivating because you get to tick off smaller wins on the way to achieving your overall target.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 159 | bei Position 2124-2126 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 19:01:39

Before you paddle quickly in the wrong direction, we MUST quickly try different marketing experiments to figure out which ones we can double down on. The best way to do this is by using an Experiment-Based Marketing list to plan and track your marketing strategies.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 165 | bei Position 2190-2192 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 19:23:56

To find the thing that does work, what you need is a process of small experiments—based on your BEST GUESS of what might work. It’s all about prioritizing tactics and ruthlessly testing them!
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 166 | bei Position 2194-2197 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 19:24:44

Now let’s get a list of marketing strategies you can do. To do that you need to know: 1. Who is your ideal customer? 2. Where are they?
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 167 | bei Position 2203-2205 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 19:27:10

CHALLENGE Who’s your customer? Describe to me who your ideal customer is. The MORE specific the better. Think about their gender, age, location, and anything else that makes them unique.
==========
Million Dollar Weekend (Kagan, Noah)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 168 | bei Position 2214-2228 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 17. Juni 2024 19:30:30

here’s a list of generic marketing ideas to get you going: Contacting your network: The number one place you should look for customers is in your own existing network. The benefit is that people already know you, so making the sale is easier. Paid ads: Reach out to potential customers on search engines like Bing and Google, so your name will appear when certain keywords are searched. Social ads: Target your audience through ads on social channels like Twitter and Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, or LinkedIn. Content marketing: Create and publish content (blogs, podcasts, videos) with the goal of generating interest in your product/service. Cold outreach: Speak directly to potential customers. This could mean picking up the phone and calling potential customers or sending cold emails to prospects. Target market blogs: Sponsor posts and content on popular blogs within your target market. Influencer marketing: Identify and build relationships with individuals who have influence over your target market (for example, high-profile bloggers or Instagrammers). PR: Pitch the press and bloggers in your niche to cover your story. SEO: Search engine optimization is another reliable way to grow your traffic, but it takes time. Do some keyword research on sites like AnswerThePublic or SpyFu to discover what people in your niche are talking about. Create hyper-targeted content to drive traffic. Giveaways: Round up some epic prizes, create a sweepstakes page … and promote the shi <Du hast die maximale Anzahl an Clipboard-Einträgen für diesen Inhalt erreicht>
==========

==========
Zero to One (Masters, Blake)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 7 | bei Position 53-55 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 21. Juni 2024 14:06:45

The paradox of teaching entrepreneurship is that such a formula necessarily cannot exist; because every innovation is new and unique, no authority can prescribe in concrete terms how to be innovative.
==========
Zero to One (Masters, Blake)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 7 | bei Position 55-56 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 21. Juni 2024 14:07:14

the single most powerful pattern I have noticed is that successful people find value in unexpected places, and they do this by thinking about business from first principles instead of formulas.
==========
Zero to One (Masters, Blake)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 8 | bei Position 64-64 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 21. Juni 2024 14:10:31

“What important truth do very few people agree with you on?”
==========
Zero to One (Masters, Blake)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 9 | bei Position 79-81 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 21. Juni 2024 14:16:43

Horizontal or extensive progress means copying things that work—going from 1 to n. Horizontal progress is easy to imagine because we already know what it looks like. Vertical or intensive progress means doing new things—going from 0 to 1. Vertical progress is harder to imagine because it requires doing something nobody else has ever done.
==========
